data.Sentence_cn: 百万分之一的机遇
data.Sentence: --- lesson 36  A chance in a million

data.Sentence_cn: 我们不再像以往那样轻易相信别人了。
data.Sentence: We are less credulous than we used to be.

data.Sentence_cn: 在19世纪，小说家常在小说结尾处给读者准备一系列的巧合--大部分是牵强附会，极不可能的。
data.Sentence: In the nineteenth century, a novelist would bring his story to a conclusion by presenting his readers with a series of coincidences -- most of them wildly improbable.

data.Sentence_cn: 当时的读者却愉快地接受这样一些事实：一个低贱的女佣实际上是主人公的母亲；
data.Sentence: Readers happily accepted the fact that an obscure maidservant was really the hero's mother.

data.Sentence_cn: 主人公一位长期失散的兄弟，大家都以为死了，实际上一直活着，并且正在策划暗算主人公；如此等等，
data.Sentence: A long-lost brother, who was presumed dead, was really alive all the time and wickedly plotting to bring about the hero's downfall. And so on.

data.Sentence_cn: 现代读者会觉得这种天真的结局完全无法接受。
data.Sentence: Modern readers would find such naive solutions totally unacceptable.

data.Sentence_cn: 不过，在现实生活中，有时确实会出现一些巧合，这些巧合除了19世纪小说家外谁也不会相信。
data.Sentence: Yet, in real life, circumstances do sometimes conspire to bring about coincidences which anyone but a nineteenth century novelist would find incredible.

data.Sentence: When I was a boy, my grandfather told me how a German taxi driver,

data.Sentence_cn: 弗朗兹.巴斯曼如何找到了据信已在20年前死去的兄弟的事。
data.Sentence: Franz Bussman, found a brother who was thought to have been killed twenty years before.

data.Sentence_cn: 一次，他与妻子徒步旅行。途中，停下来与一个工人交谈，
data.Sentence: While on a walking tour with his wife, he stopped to talk to a workman.

data.Sentence_cn: 接着他们继续往前走去。巴斯曼夫人说那工人与她丈夫相貌很像，甚至猜测他可能就是她丈夫的兄弟。
data.Sentence: After they had gone on, Mrs. Bussman commented on the workman's close resemblance to her husband and even suggested that he might be his brother.

data.Sentence_cn: 弗朗兹对此不屑一顾，指出他兄弟已经在战争中阵亡了。
data.Sentence: Franz poured scorn on the idea, pointing out that his brother had been killed in action during the war.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管巴斯曼夫人熟知这个情况，但她仍然认为自己的想法仍有百万分之一的可能性。
data.Sentence: Though Mrs. Busssman was fully acquainted with this story, she thought that there was a chance in a million that she might be right.

data.Sentence_cn: 几天后，她派了一个男孩去问那人是否叫汉斯.巴斯曼。
data.Sentence: A few days later, she sent a boy to the workman to ask him if his name was Hans Bussman.

data.Sentence_cn: 不出巴斯曼夫人所料，那人的名字真是汉斯.巴斯曼，他确实是弗朗兹失散了多年的兄弟。
data.Sentence: Needless to say, the man's name was Hans Bussman and he really was Franz's long-lost brother.

data.Sentence_cn: 兄弟俩团聚之时，汉斯说明了他活下来的经过，
data.Sentence: When the brothers were reunited, Hans explained how it was that he was still alive.

data.Sentence_cn: 战争即将结束时，他负伤被送进医院，并与部队失去联系。
data.Sentence: After having been wounded towards the end of the war, he had been sent to hospital and was separated from his unit.

data.Sentence_cn: 医院遭到轰炸，汉斯步行回到了西德。
data.Sentence: The hospital had been bombed and Hans had made his way back into Western Germany on foot.

data.Sentence_cn: 与此同时，他所在的部队被击溃，他的所有档案材料全部毁于战火。
data.Sentence: Meanwhile, his unit was lost and all records of him had been destroyed.

data.Sentence_cn: 汉斯重返故里，但他的家已被炸毁，左邻右舍谁也不知原住户的下落，
data.Sentence: Hans returned to his family home, but the house had been bombed and no one in the neighbourhood knew what had become of the inhabitants.

data.Sentence_cn: 汉斯以为全家人都在空袭中遇难，于是便在距此50英里外的一座村子里定居下来，直至当日。
data.Sentence: Assuming that his family had been killed during an air raid, Hans settled down in a village fifty miles away where he had remained ever since.
